author: Luis Cruz
subject: Quick PSX review
body:
Been playing with my new copy of "Heiwa Parlor! Pro Lupin 3rd Special".
It is a pachinko/slot (or pachi-slot) collection that features two Lupin
machines.  One of the machines can be seen here:
http://cgi.ebay.com/aw-cgi/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=1161537961

The other machine has been up on ebay in the past as well.  So, for $50,
I got exact replicas of two $200+ machines to play on my PSX.  When I say
exact replicas, I mean _exact_ replicas.  The music sounds exactly like it
is coming out of a real pachinko machine.  You can adjust the odds on how
often the slot portion will hit, adjust the prize pins, collect stats on
the machine, and more.  Best of all, you can view all the slot animations
without having to get a hit on the slots.

So, will I play it a lot?  Not really; this is more the kind of game you
would put on for a party.  Guests can walk by and amuse themselves for a
few minutes.  You could start your own little gambling parlor; be the first
yakuza kid on your block! :)

Amusingly enough, the loading screens for the game are advertisements for
another pachi-slot collection.
